security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill from trusted source. Documentation-only content covering plugin architecture patterns. No executable code, network operations, or file system access. Safe for marketplace publication.

content.value_statement: Creating well-organized plugins requires understanding Claude Code architecture, component types, and conventions. This skill provides comprehensive guidance on plugin structure, manifest configuration, and best practices for building maintainable plugins.
actual_capabilities: Explain required plugin directory layout and required files
Describe mandatory and recommended fields in plugin.json
Outline command, agent, skill, and hook organization rules
Clarify auto-discovery behavior and custom path rules
Show how to use ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} for portable paths
Provide examples from minimal to enterprise-grade plugins
limitations: Does not generate or edit files automatically
Does not validate a real plugin manifest
Does not run or test plugin components
Does not publish or install plugins

use_cases.title: Start a clean layout
use_cases.description: Get a clear folder and file map before creating a first plugin.

use_cases.title: Standardize plugin projects
use_cases.description: Align multiple teams on one structure and naming approach.

use_cases.title: Fix loading issues
use_cases.description: Trace common discovery and path problems quickly.

prompt_templates.title: Plugin layout basics
prompt_templates.scenario: You are new to Claude Code plugins
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the minimal directory structure and required files for a Claude Code plugin.

prompt_templates.title: Manifest checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: List required and recommended fields for plugin.json and give a minimal example.

prompt_templates.title: Component placement
prompt_templates.scenario: You are adding commands and skills
prompt_templates.prompt: Show where commands, agents, skills, and hooks must live and how auto discovery works.

prompt_templates.title: Portable paths
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain when to use ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} and show correct path examples for hooks and MCP servers.

output_examples.input: How should I structure a plugin with commands, skills, and hooks?
output: Place plugin.json in .claude-plugin at the root
Keep commands, agents, skills, and hooks at the root level
Use kebab case names and include SKILL.md per skill

best_practices: Use default directories before adding custom paths
anti_patterns: Using absolute paths in manifest fields

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code plugins only?
faq.answer: Yes. It documents structure and rules specific to Claude Code plugins.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only. It does not create files or validate manifests.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing plugin?
faq.answer: Yes. You can compare your layout and manifest to the rules described.

faq.question: Does it handle sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. It does not access or store user data.

faq.question: What should I do if auto discovery fails?
faq.answer: Check file locations, naming, and YAML frontmatter requirements.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic docs?
faq.answer: It focuses on Claude Code specific structure, paths, and discovery behavior.
